What I don't like is it picks an arbitrary amount of matches (Best 2 of 3 or best 3 of 5) then disproportionately weighs them more than every other match (Since they single handedly dictate whether you can be promoted or not).

The result is a factor of luck in a game of skill. You need a spree of several games in a row without any afks/trolls to be promoted. Ranked promotions shouldn't rely on having a winning spree at a crucial point. It should be about how consistently better you are than your opponents at that level. It SHOULDN'T BE about getting dealt a bad hand at a crucial moment that the system chose.

My experience exemplifies this. I won 30+ LP per match consistently in Silver V, but then lost my promos due to afks/trolls. However, when I DID win my promos, I skipped a division, meaning the system clearly realized I didn't belong there. However, because I lost two matches that it disproportionately weighed more than my previous matches, I didn't get promoted.

That is incredibly stupid and just wasted my time. The system knew full well I didn't belong there. Why force me through a ridiculous system? Put me where I belong.

Rather than jump on the complain hype-train, I'd like to suggest something and see what everyone else thinks...

Instead of a promotion series, what about an 'MMR-monitoring event'. 

When you cross the MMR threshhold between divisions, you will be monitored by the system over the next 3 games. If you stay above that MMR threshold over all 3 games, then you promote. 

This way, if you are way ahead of your current placement, then it is possible to lose 2 of the 3 games but still get promoted, as long as your MMR is still high enough after those 2 losses.

As much as your post is honest and heartfelt, I have to say that if you lose 20 games in a row in Bronze, you definitely belong in Bronze.

I appreciate your efforts in trying to get better as a player. You definitely see more in this game than your teammates. Keep trying, keep practicing ( I advise play in Ranked, not normals, normals are nothing like ranked). Watch videos on how to get better, watch streams, mine is twitch.tv/xlessthanthree I will be streaming tonight at 7pm EST and my acc is in Silver, I'll try to show you that climbing is very much possible even with "trolls" on your team. 

I believe you can rise, but you need to give it time and realize it's all on YOU, not your teammates. Some games are plain unwinnable, but MOST are winnable. If you're losing more than winning in bronze, it's on you.
http://i.imgur.com/NrWlxKm.jpg :(

In my experience, unless you're at an MMR much lower than your skill level (ex. You're Bronze 2, but steadily held gold MMR last season), don't bother trying to climb so relentlessly. It just makes ranked a stressful ordeal where you'll be on tilt and not thinking clearly.

I find myself winning Ranked matches more frequently when I'm practing in normal matches, honing my skill and knowledge of a champion or role. I have a set ratio, 20 normal games for every 1 ranked game. This lets me practice and have a cool head for when it's time to focus.

While there's definitely something to be said for the somewhat evil nature of trolls, AFKers and trolls, I think you'll find your climb in ranked to be a lot less stressful and a lot easier if you treat it like an enhanced normal match and simply prepare yourself by copious normal matches. You want to feel like you know  and are capable of absolutely everything about the role and champion you're going to be playing, and you can get that through Normal matches.

Best of luck climbing,

Promos are absolutely wack. They literally ALWAYS give you the worst players in the game. I have not gone 1 promo without an afk/troll or someone who thinks we wont win no matter what you say to them.

How i got out of promos? I stuck to jg'ing lol cause that is the only way to carry an entire team.

You are the ELO you are at because you belong there. 4v5's are possible. 4v6 are possible at lower ELOs. 

But let's be honest, those don't happen THAT often. I feel you in some ways, since D5 is troll city, but let's be honest. If you were good enough you would climb.

I beg to differ about the frequency of 4v5. For the last 2 weeks 40% of my games have had AFK's and I'm in Silver 1. Supports have the hardest time climbing because their performance depends on your whole team. If your teammates don't follow up on you, or feed in the laning phase, you're screwed both gold wise, and pressure wise, and the funny thing is, unless you leave your adc and roam, you cant do anything about it other than ward river and hope that the jg can get to those lanes soon. I find support to have the hardest time in ranked because of how little power you get when it comes to your team fighting. Sure this sounds absurd considering this is the point of most supports, but you can heal, use mikeals, shield, initiate all you want, the team fight is dependent on your teammates following up and doing damage.

 Now I do admit that some 4v5 are possible. Ive won about 6 as of right now, but the game becomes so stressful that its more about how much pressure you can take instead of the kind of skill that ranked is meant for. I can't explain what i just said very well, but what I mean is that ranked is meant to test your 5v5, not your 4v5. AFK's aren't excusable whatsoever. Numerous professionals have admitted that ranked isn't a representation of skill. A person with 1000+ games in silver is obviously more skilled than someone who started ranked at 30 and is silver. Why are they the same rank? Because of things outside of their control, like trolls and AFK's. Don't be so ignorant when it comes to ranked, sure after hundreds of games your skill level will start to even out and you will find your true rank but that doesn't mean that the common ranked BS is excusable by any means.

At least remove the division series for Bronze if anything, since Bronze is being camped by trolls right now.
